The College of Engineering has an exciting opening for a Front-End Web Developer. This is a full-time, permanent position.

The Front-End Web Developer builds and maintains websites, themes, templates and applications for the College of Engineering. This role utilizes cutting-edge methodologies and innovative approaches to enhance user interface design and construction while ensuring design excellence and modern, well-informed code. The Front-End Web Developer partners across teams to build replicable interactivity and functionality throughout a Drupal multisite ecosystem in service of expanding the College’s website ecosystem and support strategic priorities and initiatives.

As a member of the College’s Marketing and Communications team, the Front-End Web Developer is critical to ensuring that the College’s web presence supports the College and University’s goals and objectives. Also serving on the College’s Computing Services Web Development team, this role will work to ensure alignment with the team’s established best practices and coding standards and maintain the integrity and reliability of its infrastructure. This role will also partner with marketing and communications leaders, user experience practitioners, website managers and others across campus.

What You Will Do:

Create the architecture and infrastructure needed to expand the College’s website ecosystem. Collaborate with teams across the College of Engineering, and secure feedback and recommendations to ensure the website reflects the depth and diversity of the College.

Work with College leadership and communications colleagues build new websites, templates and design elements for key strategic priorities and initiatives, such as research centers, interdisciplinary institutes and other multi-department programs.

Oversee proper integration into existing deployment processes and ensure contributions align with the College’s strategic goals and platform requirements.

Create and maintain a roadmap of projects, enhancements and releases for the College’s main websites.

Design, implement and support new features to improve web content display for strategic College initiatives including recruitment, fundraising and other revenue-generating projects, prioritizing accessibility and content management best practices.

Lead website re-design projects.

Ensure landing pages for high-priority and strategic initiatives are dynamic, modern, visually engaging and accessible to all users.

Design and build custom modules for use across all Drupal websites.

Identify existing and evolving technologies to use when upgrading the websites' design and information architecture.

Own the College’s Design System , including designing, building and deploying new modules and templates.

Maintain online style guides and documentation to support best practices in web content creation. Assist in training Drupal power users on best practices for using themes and elements.

Advocate for accessibility; lead audits and apply design and implementation best practices.

Help troubleshoot and prioritize issues related to front-end development.


MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in engineering, computer science, programming, web development, human-computer interaction, web design or related field AND 3 years of experience in a front-end development role.

Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.

What You Bring:

A strong portfolio of sites that you personally developed.

Expert knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript and familiarity with the latest web techniques, technologies, languages and libraries.

Familiarity with WordPress, Drupal or other similar content management systems.

Working knowledge of LESS, SASS, or other CSS pre-processors.

Working knowledge of WCAG standards and demonstrated ability to apply enhancements for accessibility.

Expert knowledge in high-performance and in-browser graphics such as CSS animations, WebGL, SVG animations, etc.

Strong working knowledge of responsive web design and cross-platform compatible coding techniques and troubleshooting.

Strong understanding of UX standards and/or Universal Design.

Working knowledge of content management systems, including theming.

Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences.

Must be able to work successfully in a team environment as well as independently.

Must be comfortable using productivity tools such as Asana, Jira, Microsoft Office 365 and Google Suite.

Ability to communicate through a variety of technology tools such as Slack, MS Teams, Zoom and Google Meet.


What You Can Expect:

A highly collaborative and inclusive team that values working with others to complete projects and assignments.

Hybrid-work schedule with two days in the office.

Cubicle/open workspace environment that may result in higher noise levels and visual distractions.

The Materials Research Institute at Penn State seeks outstanding applicants for an Applications Developer position. The position will focus on the Center for 3D Ferroelectric Microelectronics Manufacturing (3DFeM2) DoE Engineering Frontier Research Center (EFRC). 3DFeM2 enables a radical enhancement in interconnection between memory and logic, along with order of magnitude reduction in the energy cost of computation. The 3DFeM2 center is a multi-university team including The Pennsylvania State University, Carnegie Mellon University, Georgia Institute of Technology, The University of Notre Dame, University of Maryland, University of Pennsylvania, University of Tennessee – Knoxville, and University of Virginia, in partnership with Sandia National Labs, Brookhaven National Lab, and Oak Ridge National Lab.
Role: The Applications Developer position will focus on enhancing the existing tool used by 2DCC-MIP named the Lifetime Sample Tracking Tool (LiST) to meet the specific data management requirements of 3DFeM2. The 2DCC-MIP is a National Science Foundation funded Materials Innovation Platform national facility at Penn State – the 2D Crystal Consortium. This position will establish a materials processing and synthesis database for efficient data and process logging, data sharing, meta-analysis, and project tracking tailored to 3DFeM2. The incumbent will assess existing functionality, determine what can be customized and integrated into the tool to meet 3DFeM2’s needs, and develop new features as required. The role requires collaborating with the 2DCC-MIP applications development team to adapt and integrate the tool, ensuring it effectively serves 3DFeM2 objectives and is synergistic with 2DCC-MIP functionality requirements.
Responsibilities: Task areas of the applications developer in developing this 3DFeM2 environment of LiST will include:
Establishing a materials lifetime tracking database, accounting for all processing, growth, synthesis, fabrication, and characterization. From substrate to end-of-life sample storage, with everything in between (e.g. sample splitting/dicing, sample shipments, sample processing, sample characterization, device synthesis, etc.)
Providing tools to facilitate data input and materials tracking both in time, as well as relative to a project.
Providing simple user access and input.
Providing API access to data in a cohesive machine interpretable structure.
Evaluating and enhancing the LiST codebase for the pillars above for synergy among common 3DFeM2 and 2DCC institutional data-related objectives where practical.
Education and Experience: At the minimum, this position requires a Bachelor’s Degree or higher and 3+ years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Candidates for this position must have a background in Computer Science or Information Science and Technology or a related technical field. It is preferred, but not required, that candidates also have familiarity with domain science instrumentation or data related to the research of 3DFeM2 (e.g., Physics, Materials Science and Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemistry). The position requires excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment and will include interfacing with facility managers at various 3DFeM2 external institutions for inclusion in the tool.
Specific desired experience:
Robust web application and REST API development experience, using languages such as C#, PHP, Java, Python, JavaScript and/or TypeScript as well as front end frameworks (e.g., React, Vue)
Experience integrating with authentication using OpenID, JWT, OAuth, Shibboleth and Azure Active Directory
Experience with SQL and/or NoSQL databases
Experience integrating Microsoft tools via GraphAPI and cloud-based web applications are a plus
Familiarity with data and data series visualization; experience with front-end and/or back-end tools for visual data representation is a plus
This is a term appointment funded for one year from date of hire with excellent possibility of renewal.

Additionally, the NRCCO maintains web communications, print/broadcast media programs, contact platforms and other online resources in partnership with all of SARE’s national partners, including addressing IT system security and accessibility requirements.

Through the activities described below, the Web Services Developer will help develop, manage and maintain the IT systems for national SARE programs.

The position will be employed through UMD’s College of Agriculture and Natural Resources, at College Park, Md. They will report to the SARE Associate Director and work under the guidance of SARE’s IT Director to collaboratively support all NRCCO colleagues and SARE’s national partners. The Web Services Developer will also be responsible for providing IT support to SARE’s Food Loss and Waste National Grant and Training and Technical Assistance (FLW) program. This is a new, temporary program that requires similar IT support and focus to all SARE grant and outreach programs, but with specific needs required by the USDA NIFA to uphold its FLW program priorities.
